column4: Does anyone here have experience installing ubuntu through PXE?
Ubuntu loads through PXE, says install ubuntu, loads a new interface where it says Select your language. And there it's stuck.
r u getting an IP from bootp or the option to add an ip manually?
if i am correct, it might not downloaded the full install from network ... therefore it might be loosing its ip address and the load of the install failes
by obtaining the ip address of the device you are trying, you can continuously ping it to rule it out
isnt there an install shell that runs paralel to X installer? ... you ALT over to that and see if you have access
so what do you suggest (Sorry i lost connection)
anyone else knowledge about PXE boot?
please i need some help guys, my computer is not loading from usb drive for some reason :( so i really need help setting up PXE
yes, it recognizes the usb device as well in bios, the usb stick is bootable
sorry mbeierl, @usr13: It's a foxconn nt-A3500 so its a nettop. It doesn't have that feature i can only set boot order
I have PXE  running, until a certain point
When i reach the Select your language screen, its frozen
did u check for a paralel install shell?
I believe there is also a log window too
